articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed on with their operations near the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis on Monday amid an international push for a deal to halt the fighting in Gaza and block a slide into a wider regional conflict with Iran and its proxies.
articles.title: Israel keeps up strikes in Gaza as fears of wider war grow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia on Monday evacuated parts of another region next to Ukraine after Kyiv sharply increased military activity near the border just days after its biggest incursion into sovereign Russian territory since the start of the 2022 war.
articles.title: Russia evacuates another border region amid growing threat from Ukrainian units

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Moscow's forces are in their sixth day of intense battles against Kyiv's largest incursion into Russian territory since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: Downed Ukraine-launched missile injures 13 in Russia's Kursk, regional officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant told U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Sunday that Iran was making preparations for a large-scale military attack on Israel, Axios reporter Barak Ravid said in a post on X, citing a source with knowledge of the call.
articles.title: Israeli minister tells US that large-scale Iranian attack expected, Axios reports

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: South Korea and the United States will begin annual summertime military drills next week to ramp up their capability to counter North Korea's weapons and cyber threats, officials said on Monday.
articles.title: South Korea, US to stage annual drills over North's missile, cyber threats

articles.author: Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong's top court on Monday unanimously dismissed the bid to overturn the convictions of media tycoon Jimmy Lai and six other pro-democracy campaigners for an unauthorised assembly in 2019.
articles.title: Hong Kong court dismisses bid by media tycoon Jimmy Lai to overturn conviction

articles.author: Richard Cowan, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk is due to interview Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on the X social media network on Monday in an event that could inject more surprises into the turbulent U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Elon Musk to interview Trump on X social media network

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The Democratic National Committee will spend over $100,000 in a first-ever push to register the 9 million Americans living abroad, working to win votes for the party's nominee Vice President Kamala Harris in the Nov. 5 presidential election.
articles.title: Democrats target US swing state voters overseas to win support for Harris

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police said they arrested a man after an 11 year old girl and a 34 year old woman were stabbed in Leicester Square, an area in central London popular with tourists.
articles.title: Man arrested after two stabbed in London's Leicester Square, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine accused each other of starting a fire at the dormant Russian-occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine on Sunday, but both sides reported no sign of elevated radiation.
articles.title: Nuclear plant fire: Ukraine and Russia trade blame
